body:
This is a bug with the new default "flatten minimal". 
You can work around with `--with-flatten=full`, which gives you the behavior of v0.14

issue.title: Swagger update to 0.15.0

repository.name: gsclientgen
repository.description: Go client library for the deprecatd Giant Swarm Rest API, generated based on a Swagger/OAI spec with go-swagger

issue.body:
This updates the generator to version 0.15.0 and provides the latest generated code.

The `--with-flatten=full` flag is added to account for a change in the behaviour of g-swagger. See https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/1621#issuecomment-405604360

body: Thanks! It works for us with `--with-flatten=full`.

The problem is caused here. I don't know yet why it is occurring.
```yaml
  /v4/user/:
    get:
      operationId: getCurrentUser
...
      responses:
#        "200":
#          description: Success
#          schema:
#            $ref: "./definitions.yaml#/definitions/V4UserListItem"
#          examples:
#            application/json:
#             {"email": "andy@example.com", "created": "2017-01-15T12:00:00Z", "expiry": "2019-01-15T00:00:00Z"}
```

If I comment out this response, everything works again... Weird.    
```

ok I found out where the problem  is. It is a bug in go-openapi/analysis flatten.

I'll try to fix it over next week end.

By this time, as a work around your spec works with default mode if you inline the $ref in the above mentioned response.

issue.title: Improvements to minimal flattening
issue.body:
* fixes #1621
* fixes #1614
* improves #1602 and #1614 (flatten consistent with validate regarding pointers to responses/parameters as schemas)

Carry out vendor update, including:
* go-openapi/swag (comparing floats)
* mailru/easyjson

issue.title: optional absolute path in circular $ref
issue.body:
* Added option to expand circular $ref with absolute path

This option is selected by default when expanding with a root schema
instead of a BasePath

* Added ExpandResponseWithRoot() and ExpandParameterWithRoot() to cover the validate use case

* Fixed relative path issue in ExpandResponse() and ExpandParameter() (failed to resolve $ref when resolved
in another location than .)

* Contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#1614
* Contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#1621

issue.title: Fix flatten with pointers containing escaped chars
issue.body:
Fix flatten with pointers containing escaped chars (e.g. '{}')

Fixed undue duplicate name detection when resolving remote refs

Improves behavior in edge cases where schemas points to responses
or parameters.

This makes the flatten behavior consistent with swagger validate.

* now unmarshalls the struct as a schema: if this works, flattening
moves on, with a warning to the user (as this is valid but most
likely unintended)
* improves go-swagger/go-swagger#1602 and go-swagger/go-swagger#1614
* contributes go-swagger/go-swagger#1621
* Expand schemas when $ref'ed to (shared) responses or parameters
